H0.text: Metal is most likely covered by plastic because plastic conducts very little thermal energy or electricity.

H1.text: Wood would most likely be covered with plastic because plastic conducts very little thermal energy or electricity.

H2.text: Solids are most likely covered by plastic because plastic conducts very little thermal energy or electricity.

H3.text: Liquids would most likely be covered by plastic because plastic conducts very little thermal energy or electricity.

A4.text: Engineering plastics are more robust and are used to manufacture vehicle parts, building and construction materials, and machine parts.

A5.text: While a conductivity of up to 80 kilosiemens per centimeter (kS/cm) in stretch-oriented polyacetylene has been achieved, it does not approach that of most metals. For example, copper has a conductivity of several hundred kS/cm.

A6.text: The act of insulation is accomplished by encasing an object in material with low thermal conductivity in high thickness.
